verses.verse: When I would have healed <S%H7495><s%> Israel, <S%H3478><s%> then the iniquity <S%H5771><s%> of Ephraim <S%H669><s%> was discovered, <S%H1540><s%> and the wickedness <S%H7451><s%> of Samaria: <S%H8111><s%> for <S%H3588><s%> they commit <S%H6466><s%> falsehood; <S%H8267><s%> and the thief <S%H1590><s%> cometh in, <S%H935><s%> and the troop of robbers <S%H1416><s%> spoileth <S%H6584><s%> without. <S%H2351><s%>

And they consider <S%H559><s%> not <S%H1077><s%> in their hearts <S%H3824><s%> that I remember <S%H2142><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> their wickedness: <S%H7451><s%> now <S%H6258><s%> their own doings <S%H4611><s%> have beset them about; <S%H5437><s%> they are <S%H1961><s%> before <S%H5048><s%> my face. <S%H6440><s%>
They make the king glad <S%H8055><s%> <S%H4428><s%> with their wickedness, <S%H7451><s%> and the princes <S%H8269><s%> with their lies. <S%H3585><s%>

They are all <S%H3605><s%> adulterers, <S%H5003><s%> as <S%H3644><s%> an oven <S%H8574><s%> heated <S%H1197><s%> by <S%H4480><s%> the baker, <S%H644><s%> who ceaseth <S%H7673><s%> from raising <S%H4480><s%> <S%H5782><s%> after he hath kneaded <S%H4480><s%> <S%H3888><s%> the dough, <S%H1217><s%> until <S%H5704><s%> it be leavened. <S%H2556><s%>

In the day <S%H3117><s%> of our king <S%H4428><s%> the princes <S%H8269><s%> have made him sick <S%H2470><s%> with bottles <S%H2534><s%> of wine; <S%H4480><s%> <S%H3196><s%> he stretched out <S%H4900><s%> his hand <S%H3027><s%> with <S%H854><s%> scorners. <S%H3945><s%>

For <S%H3588><s%> they have made ready <S%H7126><s%> their heart <S%H3820><s%> like an oven, <S%H8574><s%> while they lie in wait: <S%H693><s%> their baker <S%H644><s%> sleepeth <S%H3463><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> the night; <S%H3915><s%> in the morning <S%H1242><s%> it <S%H1931><s%> burneth <S%H1197><s%> as a flaming <S%H3852><s%> fire. <S%H784><s%>

They are all hot <S%H2552><s%> <S%H3605><s%> as an oven, <S%H8574><s%> and have devoured <S%H398><s%> <S%H853><s%> their judges; <S%H8199><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> their kings <S%H4428><s%> are fallen: <S%H5307><s%> there is none <S%H369><s%> among them that calleth <S%H7121><s%> unto <S%H413><s%> me.

Ephraim, <S%H669><s%> he <S%H1931><s%> hath mixed himself <S%H1101><s%> among the people; <S%H5971><s%> Ephraim <S%H669><s%> is <S%H1961><s%> a cake <S%H5692><s%> not <S%H1097><s%> turned. <S%H2015><s%>

Strangers <S%H2114><s%> have devoured <S%H398><s%> his strength, <S%H3581><s%> and he <S%H1931><s%> knoweth <S%H3045><s%> it not: <S%H3808><s%> yea, <S%H1571><s%> gray hairs <S%H7872><s%> are here and there <S%H2236><s%> upon him, yet he <S%H1931><s%> knoweth <S%H3045><s%> not. <S%H3808><s%>

And the pride <S%H1347><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%> testifieth <S%H6030><s%> to his face: <S%H6440><s%> and they do not <S%H3808><s%> return <S%H7725><s%> to <S%H413><s%> the LORD <S%H3068><s%> their God, <S%H430><s%> nor <S%H3808><s%> seek <S%H1245><s%> him for all <S%H3605><s%> this. <S%H2063><s%>

Ephraim <S%H669><s%> also is <S%H1961><s%> like a silly <S%H6601><s%> dove <S%H3123><s%> without <S%H369><s%> heart: <S%H3820><s%> they call <S%H7121><s%> to Egypt, <S%H4714><s%> they go <S%H1980><s%> to Assyria. <S%H804><s%>

When <S%H834><s%> they shall go, <S%H1980><s%> I will spread <S%H6566><s%> my net <S%H7568><s%> upon <S%H5921><s%> them; I will bring them down <S%H3381><s%> as the fowls <S%H5775><s%> of the heaven; <S%H8064><s%> I will chastise <S%H3256><s%> them, as their congregation <S%H5712><s%> hath heard. <S%H8088><s%>

Woe <S%H188><s%> unto them! for <S%H3588><s%> they have fled <S%H5074><s%> from <S%H4480><s%> me: destruction <S%H7701><s%> unto them! because <S%H3588><s%> they have transgressed <S%H6586><s%> against me: though I <S%H595><s%> have redeemed <S%H6299><s%> them, yet they <S%H1992><s%> have spoken <S%H1696><s%> lies <S%H3577><s%> against <S%H5921><s%> me.

And they have not <S%H3808><s%> cried <S%H2199><s%> unto <S%H413><s%> me with their heart, <S%H3820><s%> when <S%H3588><s%> they howled <S%H3213><s%> upon <S%H5921><s%> their beds: <S%H4904><s%> they assemble themselves <S%H1481><s%> for <S%H5921><s%> corn <S%H1715><s%> and wine, <S%H8492><s%> and they rebel <S%H5493><s%> against me.
Though I <S%H589><s%> have bound <S%H3256><s%> and strengthened <S%H2388><s%> their arms, <S%H2220><s%> yet do they imagine <S%H2803><s%> mischief <S%H7451><s%> against <S%H413><s%> me.

They return, <S%H7725><s%> but not <S%H3808><s%> to the most High: <S%H5920><s%> they are <S%H1961><s%> like a deceitful <S%H7423><s%> bow: <S%H7198><s%> their princes <S%H8269><s%> shall fall <S%H5307><s%> by the sword <S%H2719><s%> for the rage <S%H4480><s%> <S%H2195><s%> of their tongue: <S%H3956><s%> this <S%H2097><s%> shall be their derision <S%H3933><s%> in the land <S%H776><s%> of Egypt. <S%H4714><s%>
